bodydiv.p: Investors, and investment intermediaries such as analysts, tend to be under-represented as submitters of comment letters and, therefore, the Board takes additional steps to consult investors throughout standard-setting. These additional steps could include surveys, private meetings, webcasts and meetings with representative groups, such as the Capital Markets Advisory Committee. Feedback from this consultation with investors is summarised in a staff paper and is considered and assessed along with comment letters. The reporting of this feedback is as transparent as possible, while respecting requests for confidentiality.
